alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 6:03PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL BALDWIN... ESCAMBIA...COVINGTON...NORTHERN OKALOOSA...NORTHERN SANTA ROSA AND NORTHWESTERN ESCAMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 502 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Opp to Riverview to 11 miles west of McCullough. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crestview, Andalusia, Atmore, Opp, Brewton, Florala, Century, Flomaton, Baker, McCullough, East Brewton, Jay, Laurel Hill, Lockhart, Pollard, Riverview, Bratt, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 113, and I65 And AL 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland
